Message.Title: Transaction at open
Message.Msg: Any plausible explanation for the 3.5M shares exchanged at the open at price of $10.52? Did DELL corporate get involved? The transaction seems prearranged. Currently, there is a deluge of 100 share transactions. The shorts still seem busy. However, they need to be aware that ex-dividend is just around the corner. CTG

Message.Title: No capitulation!
Message.Msg: Is the dividend 15 years too late? The buyback has hurt for years, but if they want to go all in with the buyback, it better be below $10, stupid waste of money.

Message.Title: THis has to close above $10.83 today!
Message.Msg: Or it is going sub $10 for sure next week! Good job management!

A block transaction of 3.5 million shares could just as well been a huge buy order...instead of a sell order. Hard to ascertain which it truly was BUY or SELL. Capitulation doesn't seem correct. The big players have already shed their stakes on the downdraft over the last few months. At this time, weak shareholders may let go their shares for steep losses, but for me that is exactly the time to buy. Prudent investors are buying now, but an immediate turn around is not too likely. The dividend puts added pressure on the shorts--every three months--yet the most important item is how much revenue can be generated with products related to Windows 8 release. Those results require at least one Q of results released to the public. For me, I've been waiting for the Dell-Windows 8 products to be available to purchase. I'll buy both Desktop and Laptop devices...I know a lot of others that have postponed new PC purchases because Windows 8 launch was imminent. I continue to buy shares at this level... CTG
It has a huge drop next week coming, watch!
